newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bomb explosion kills 21 in Algiers.
newsitem.headline: Bomb explosion kills 21 in Algiers.

text.p: A powerful bomb ripped through a bustling street in central Algiers on Sunday, killing at least 21 people and wounding more than 60, the Algerian news agency APS reported.
The explosion took place in Belouizdad street in Belcourt district.
A resident, speaking by telephone from Algiers, said the bomb hidden in a bag exploded near a crowded cafe and a cinema known as Cinema Musset.

Earlier the security forces said in a statement carried by APS that 36 people were killed in Sidi Abdelaziz village in Medea province, a Moslem guerrilla stronghold, 70 km (40 miles) south of Algiers.
The killing was the worst in a series of massacres, mostly in remote villages, and bombings in Algiers and surrounding towns in which more than 300 people have died in the past two-and-a-half months.
They blamed the massacre on a "group of terrorists", the term the authorities use to describe Moslem guerrillas in Algeria.
